bow: is bedtime with year old easy for anyone what am doing wrong my year old recently fully potty trained moved out of his crib and gave up his pacifier we had about two weeks of easy bedtimes and now it have to use the potty tell me another story delay delay delay it taking two hours hesitate to say no to the potty tonight the second time he asked to go he pooped is it this hard for everyone or is it just me it ll get easier just establish bedtime routine and stick with it ours is bath at brush teeth pajamas story cuddle time prayers turn on noise machine projector light and out you re definitely not doing anything wrong it just an age thing and they all go through it it sounds like lot has been happening that could be keeping little mind busy my son ca turn his mind off when he accomplished new things or changes happen every kid is different some nights my almost 3yr daughter gives us hard time for 30+ minutes other nights she potty brushteeth book bed in 10 minutes she also gets back up occasionally but usually only once my wife and switch off on gentle admonishing when she does get up he stick with the routine it ll pass ymmv but we ended up putting my daughter potty chair in her room she rarely uses it but it eliminated the excuse of wanting to go to the potty we also got toddler alarm clock there are couple options on amazon but basically it clock with light on timer she knows that when the light is off she needs to be quiet and in bed it comes on in the morning and then she knows it okay to get up we allow her to play quietly in bed until she falls asleep and do bother too much unless she is clearly out of bed and being rowdy she gets puff ball in her good behavior jar for every morning that she stays quiet in bed until her light comes on what do you do if the kiddo gets up that what struggling with my daughter now and half did it for while too she eventually stopped doing it routinely or so intensely for such long times but she still has her days never say no to bathroom breaks because she still wets the bed some nights so actually do mind if she gets up to pee when she having hard time falling asleep other excuses though on the nights she gets up frequently usually tell her not to get up again after couple of times she likes to get up to tell me she has some or other pain or if she remembers something she forgot about earlier or if we forgot to put some cream on her eczema patch etc we gave up her hour and half daily nap turned bedtime from hour nightmare into hour dream no nap sucks but bedtime is wonderful now instant results and she sleeps 12 full hours night my kids are still very much like this even with medication that apparently should help the youngest sleep *internal crying* always an excuse for why they have to get up minute after bedtime and 30 minutes after bedtime and hour after bedtime lol my youngest still gets up usually around times through the night too they re almost 10 and chronic insomniac so gon na take wild guess at this point and just say that they re probably just like me hopefully for you it can be turned around but it most definitely phase at this age stick with strict routine and you should notice difference no it not easy for me at least the potty thing sucks because my kid is obviously manipulating me but then does produce often on the second or third time out of her room and we always try the potty as part of our bedtime routine argh with my now year old have learned that it all just phases and it gets better with strict bedtime routine that you deviate from as little as possible behaviour chart 10 nights in row then small reward worked for me little kids need their naps we found the same with my daughter we ve come to the agreement she chooses three bedtime stories in the morning that she would like to read that night and they are left on her bed ready for bedtime we also have potty that is in her room that she can use so there no excuse that she needs to go back to use the toilet once she in her room hope this helps my advice is to be prepared keep the potty in the bedroom have glass of water on table in the bedroom and establish clearly ina advance and get him to agree to the amount of stories you will read and also agree that after the final story is read he will go to bed and lie down it not foolproof but it cuts down on some of the stress what happens when the good behavior jar is full we do the same bedtime routine every night 20 min the parts we saw him trying to elongate we started giving him sticker for cooperating the kid will do lot for sticker unfortunately he does like putting them on chart he wants to wear them so have to pick off bunch of stickers before laundry walk them straight back to bed no eye contact it soon becomes boring to them well you hope we had to limit nap to see progress is he still napping every child is different and their needs may vary at 3yo think it ok to drop the nap and just have quiet hour we also gave up the nap for both my kids when they were about when their 8:00 bedtimes were somehow morphing into 9:30 that told me they just weren tired enough for sleep at also do you have white noise machine that can stay on all night this will help block out noises of you moving about the house less reason for him to get out of bed kids naturally want to practice their newfound independence at this age so just stay patient firm have let my kids know now and that if they really aren tired they can continue to play quietly in bed my 3yo will often play with his trucks for bit my 5yo doodles and then they both roll over and go to sleep on their own don mind if they are up bit so long as they know mama is off duty and sleep is expected not really mine dropped hers the week she turned she is now and hasn nap in over year she does sleep 6:30pm 7am though so can complain she also does hour and half of quiet time 12 1:30 where she has to stay in her room and play quietly having set of stories is super important when we choose books my guys says that how many books we read and helps me chose the books then after we re done he still asks for more but does fight it when say we re all done because he knows they will always try though routine helps lot find remember this stage she still tries once in while just say no if she needs to pee she goes pee without hassle yay for fully independent potty trained year olds it will get better like others have said be prepared with water bottle pee break and amount of stories after that say no its bedtime even to the 15 hugs mine gets up and parties on her own go in there every 30 minutes it can go on for hours when you walk them straight back to bed would you do it regardless of if they came out of their room or not like should sit by her bedroom door and go in to put her back in bed every time she gets up period well that an interesting little idea what does play in her bed entail feel like that could easily cross into disruptive play time got yr old too it does get easier let you and your spouse completely agree on bedtime routine ish but mostly on where you allow exceptions for example if my son says he has to use the potty have him sit there for minutes with book to look at if he does go in that time then he has bedtime diaper as precaution or if he is really sick then he is allowed in our bed so we can monitor him otherwise we do dinner potty bath 30 mins quiet platime potty books depending on behavior potty again song lots of hugs and kisses and goodnight our big turn around was hard rule if he gets out of bed then we shut his door he has night lights if he wants it open then he has to stay in bed for the first days of the new bed door rule was full of straight 30 mins of crying but now he has it down if he is having rough day we ll let certain things slide like if he gets out of bed we ll talk to each other while ignoring him that we re about to check on him and the door gets shut if he is out of bed he high tails it out of the room at that point and we go in to actually check on him sleep book skeptic but the happy sleeper approach is totally working for us they get last call for stuff potty drink of water blankets stuffed animal that went missing etc and that the end of the line then we do their reverse sleep wave and check on him every minutes until he falls asleep so most of the time like twice we went from having to lie down with him while he fell asleep which was taking foreeeever and driving me bananas to happy and efficient bedtime routine only rough night about week into the new routine while he pushed back and relatively smooth sailing since then we have couple talking teddy toys also will list my year old play with one until she passes out as long as she stays in her room fine we also leave her cup of water and put potty in her room excuses covered id say yes because it bed time and that where she should be my little guys both have stuffed animals in their beds and if they do fall asleep right away they just whisper talk with the stuffies this is what we have been doing and it has been working pretty well she takes hour nap every day at school and just plain is tired by have her do bedtime routine at we go to her room at 8:30 but let her stay up and play quietly until she is ready she has just been putting herself to bed when she gets there usually half an hour of playing on her own the off duty part is key though mama needs break think you re right he learned new skill he has new freedom and he no longer has the soothing device that helped him settled to sleep for three years this sounds great my little guy is highly motivated by rewards he is hours day at preschool can really change that it part of the school routine just want to comment asking you for how you got rid of the paci my year old is hardcore obsessed with his while sleeping and dreading trying to take it away unfortunately yes bedtime has never been an issue with my kid even when he was baby unless we were in an unfamiliar place we established routine of hugs and noses then upstairs lights off in bed with puppy and binky he always gone willingly so unfortunately can only offer sympathy but no experience in this good luck and remember that all things shall pass she gets to pick toy or treat at the store usually she looks at books and plays with her stuffies if she does get too disruptive we do go in and tell her she needs to be laying quietly in bed it took couple days but now she has pretty good understanding of what constitutes play quietly was so worried about it too and then it ended up being easy one day said to him when you are ready you can trade in your pacifier for toy his eyes lit up said what kind of toy do you think you like to trade your pacifier for he said crane truck two nights later he realized his pacifier had hole in it before when this had happened thrown it away so he knew the drill he said mommy my pacifier is broken throw it away and get crane truck threw away the pacifier and told him order the crane truck we looked at picture of it online and said okay they are putting it in box and loading it on truck to bring to you he was very excited but eventually settled and went to sleep the next night he asked for his pacifier and said you traded it in what did you trade it for he said crane truck then he shouted no more pacifiers big boy play with the big boys he hasn asked for the pacifier since and the first few nights slept with the crane truck next to his bed shocked and amazed it was not the fight thought it would be and for few weeks he went to bed no problem recently bed time has taken longer but he never been upset about the pacifier my son has screen in his room that we put ambient fish or whatever on so he has something to concentrate on while falling asleep youtube has tons of videos and they last all night you could also do sticker chart every night they go to bed and stay there they get sticker the next morning you determine how many stickers in row it takes to earn prize that how potty trained my son thanks also should have said if he needs the toilet or gets out of bed after bedtime try to shepherd him in calm silence as little attention as possible good luck that not true when it comes to naps little kids need naps so they can grow while you are sleeping more of your brain is free to do growing child things your no eye contact comment made me giggle it like dealing with wild animal haha but definitely know what you meant try so hard and to not smile or laugh but wind up just giggling terrible that funny are you pediatrician because they say otherwise would listen to them because they know what they are talking about ohh man ended up using hardcore bribery to get him over his poop on the poddy fears and it worked like charm here hoping it will for that too thanks when did you start the good behavior jar very neat idea mom with three and half year old like others noticed he wouldn go to bed until 9:39 even 10 some nights when bedtime routine was at there would be constant struggle drop the nap not every day and he would go to bed just fine by sometimes by 7:30 and we talked about this with his dr and she said it was fine if he was getting the proper total sleep per day ve tried both it funny my son went through week period where he play every night and fall asleep on the floor the battle to get him to stay bed wasn worth it then think he figured out that he was too tired and the bed was the best place to be just go with your gut we went through it when we had newborn as well we were definitely not giggling lol could you ask them to wake him up after 1hr understand what you re saying but the person you responded to does give you enough information to know if their child is at an age where this applies also love some academic material on your point for my own reading thanks about six months ago when she turned three it been pretty useful tool both for enforcing good behavior and for shutting down whining at the store if she sees something she wants can give her concrete goal that is cool toy let keep filling up your jar and maybe next time we can get it instead of just giving the flat no pediatrition don always know what they are talking about ours actually tells us often not to believe all the outdated stuff lot of pediatrition still try to push on parents who do you think supported not breastfeeding formula for 30+ years anyway used the book healthy sleep habits happy child by mark weissbluth for all my child napping questions and in the section on toddler napping it said that about 50 of three year olds still take an afternoon nap which is fine as long as they get solid night sleep in by giving up her nap and ending the nighttime struggle we re happier she happier and all is well again for now as others have said bedtime routine is super important that and stick to your guns sometimes that might mean there is tantrum but once they realise you re not backing down they are less likely to try it on our three year old has dinner then bath time with her brother then into night nappy and pjs bedtime story and cuddle drink of water and then off to bed we do this every night occasionally skipping bath time if we are short for time and bedtime is breeze hope things get easier for you soon promise it
